channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16208] Make TableBasedReplicationQueuesImpl check that queue exists before attempting to remove it
item.description: Currently calling TableBasedReplicationQueuesImpl.removeQueue(String queueId) will cause it to delete the row with the given queue id. Yet this row is not created until the first log is registered for the queue. This causes the server to abort if we every try to remove a queue that has not had a log registered to it yet.
item.summary: Make TableBasedReplicationQueuesImpl check that queue exists before attempting to remove it

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Is there a race here? Could someone be trying to add that exact queue while you are trying to delete it?

-1 overall

Because the server-name is unique to a given queue and because only the original creator of a queue will add logs to a given queue (adding a log is how you create a row for a queue in the Replication table), I think we don't have to worry about this race condition between servers. Within a single server, logs are only added during the preLogRoll and addSource(), and only removed with removePeer(). But there is a safeguard (synchronizing on ReplicationPeers) during removePeer() to prevent race conditions between removePeer() and preLogRoll(). I think the behavior of calling addSource and removePeer on the same peer at the same time is undefined and should be left up to the user to be reasonable? What do you think Elliott Clark? It would also be easy for me to run the checkAndPut without aborting too though. I will put up a patch with that version.

So I put up a checkAndPut (v1) version and a refactored check exist then delete (v2) patches up. I prefer v2 though, because it provides more information about the owner of the queue and will abort the server if something goes very wrong with queue ownership changing beneath you.
